answers.answer: You need to see an ophthalmologist.  This could be a compromised circulatory problem.

Thank you for answering my question, but can you tell me what a compromised circulatory problem is? It sounds serious. I am concerned that I may have developed type 2 diabetes. Is this a symptom? I will be making an appointment with my doctor. Thanks.
A problem with your blood flow.  I don't think this is related to diabetes.

question: Almost every time I am bent down for a period of time to, for example, wash a floor or lift things off the ground, I will notice a black circle in each eye that sometimes appears as a semi-circle once I am standing again. It doesn't really affect my vision, but they are clearly there. After about 5 minutes or so they fade away completely, until I repeat the action again. I have suffered with migraines of all varied degrees for 12 years and I am used to seeing black spots, flashers, etc., before an attack, but sometimes a migraine or headache will hit after seeing these circles, and other times I get the circles with no indication of pain. Any one have an idea of what might be going on? Thanks.
title: Vision Impairment after bending or straining?
